books.author: Jennette McCurdy
books.description: The actress and filmmaker describes her eating disorders and difficult relationship with her mother. Read by the author. 6 hours, 25 minutes unabridged.
books.title: I'M GLAD MY MOM DIED

books.author: Gabor Maté with Daniel Maté
books.contributor: by Gabor Maté with Daniel Maté
books.description: The potential ways in which trauma and stress from modern-day living can affect our physical health. Read by Daniel Maté. 18 hours, 13 minutes unabridged.
books.title: THE MYTH OF NORMAL

books.author: Matthew McConaughey
books.description: The Academy Award-winning actor shares snippets from the diaries he kept over the last 35 years. Read by the author. 6 hours, 42 minutes unabridged.
books.title: GREENLIGHTS

books.author: Peter Baker and Susan Glasser
books.contributor: by Peter Baker and Susan Glasser
books.description: The married journalists who write for The New York Times and The New Yorker posit that Donald Trump began to emulate the foreign autocrats he admired. Read by Michael Quinlan. 28 hours, 47 minutes unabridged.
books.title: THE DIVIDER

books.author: Bessel van der Kolk
books.description: How trauma affects the body and mind, and innovative treatments for recovery. Read by Sean Pratt. 16 hours, 17 minutes unabridged.
books.title: THE BODY KEEPS THE SCORE

books.author: Viola Davis
books.description: The multiple award-winning actress describes the difficulties she encountered before claiming her sense of self and achieving professional success. Read by the author. 9 hours, 15 minutes unabridged.
books.title: FINDING ME

books.author: Neil deGrasse Tyson
books.description: The astrophysicist and director of the Hayden Planetarium delves into subjects including politics, religion, gender and race. Read by the author. 7 hours, 17 minutes unabridged.
books.title: STARRY MESSENGER

books.author: Jocko Willink and Leif Babin
books.contributor: by Jocko Willink and Leif Babin
books.description: Applying the principles of Navy SEALs leadership training to any organization. Read by the authors. 8 hours, 15 minutes unabridged.
books.title: EXTREME OWNERSHIP

books.author: Geoffrey Berman
books.description: The former U.S. attorney for the Southern District of New York gives his account of pushing back against the Trump Justice Department. Read by the author. 9 hours, 34 minutes unabridged.
books.title: HOLDING THE LINE

books.author: Bruce D. Perry and Oprah Winfrey
books.contributor: by Bruce D. Perry and Oprah Winfrey
books.description: An approach to dealing with trauma that shifts an essential question used to investigate it. Read by the authors. 8 hours, 27 minutes unabridged.
books.title: WHAT HAPPENED TO YOU?

books.author: Nina Totenberg
books.description: The NPR legal affairs correspondent details her professional accomplishments and friendship with the late Supreme Court Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg. Read by the author. 9 hours, 30 minutes unabridged.
books.title: DINNERS WITH RUTH

books.author: Kelly Ripa
books.description: The Daytime Emmy Award-winning TV host shares stories from her life on and off screen. Read by the author. 9 hours, 59 minutes unabridged.
books.title: LIVE WIRE

books.author: Trevor Noah
books.description: A memoir about growing up in South Africa by the host of “The Daily Show.” Read by the author. 8 hours, 50 minutes unabridged.
books.title: BORN A CRIME

books.author: David Corn
books.description: The Washington bureau chief for Mother Jones magazine gives his take on the Republican Party over the last seven decades. Read by Steven Jay Cohen. 17 hours, 32 minutes.
books.title: AMERICAN PSYCHOSIS

books.author: Yuval Noah Harari
books.description: How Homo sapiens became Earth’s dominant species. Read by Derek Perkins. 15 hours, 17 minutes unabridged.
books.title: SAPIENS

books.contributor: by Jocko Willink and Leif Babin
books.title: EXTREME OWNERSHIP

books.title: THE END OF THE WORLD IS JUST THE BEGINNING

books.title: JESSI'S SECRET LANGUAGE

books.description: When she becomes a bodyguard for a mafia family on a cruise ship, Yor begins to doubt her secret life as an assassin.
books.title: SPY X FAMILY, VOL. 8

books.description: The third book in the Cat Kid Comic Club series. Fame, fortune and creativity pull the members of the comic club in different directions.

books.description: Dani and Dorian search for their lost allies.
books.title: HOOKY, VOL. 2

books.description: Charlie and Nick deal with the ups and downs of high school at the same time they grow closer together.
books.title: HEARTSTOPPER, VOL. 1

books.description: The 10th book in the Dog Man series. Can the power of love overcome the darkness and despair created by new villains?

books.description: A master spy must pass himself off as a family man to infiltrate a private school, but his new wife is an assassin and adopted child is a telepath.

books.description: The second book in the Whistler series. Investigator Lacy Stoltz goes after a serial killer and closes in on a sitting judge.

books.description: In a quiet town on the North Carolina coast in 1969, a young woman who survived alone in the marsh becomes a murder suspect.
books.title: WHERE THE CRAWDADS SING

books.description: The 25th book in the J.P. Beaumont series. Beaumont tracks a missing person in wintertime Alaska.
